The funding agreement between the Trump Administration and Speaker Pelosi secures critical funding to continue rebuilding and modernizing our armed forces. It's the deal that our national defense needs.

I am glad the administration and Speaker Pelosi have reached a two-year funding agreement that secures the resources we need to continue rebuilding our armed forces. The next step is for the House and the Senate to pass this agreement so that President Trump can sign it into law.

This week, the senate is considering several important tax treaties with foreign trading partners. These treaties account for trillions of dollars in foreign investments across the country, cultivate robust trading relationships and create certainty for job creators.

Thanks to Republican policies of the last 2 years, Kentucky is helping lead the charge. I couldn’t be prouder of my home state’s record-breaking low unemployment rate and growth in jobs and investment.

Kentucky is proud of our diverse economy. Turns out bourbon and horse races are a winning combination. We also take huge pride in manufacturing, agriculture, mining and coal. They keep the lights on in America’s heartland.

Since January 2017, Republicans in Congress have partnered with the Trump administration to get our nation’s opportunity economy going and growing again for everyone. The results? Unemployment has fallen to near 50-year lows and stayed there.
